reviews.review_msg: Peter was an excellent professor to have, considering he used to be a dean a UVIC and now teaches this course. Peter would have very engaging lectures, you can any questions you want to the TA or to him and receive comprehensive feedback or input. I don't even like math but I would take this class again.
If you love professors telling dad jokes, take a class with Peter Keller. This guy is a gem with dad jokes, lectures are so fun to listen too when he tells his amazing dad jokes all the time!!!

He makes extremely difficult exams, but if you study you will get a B becuase labs are worth so much of your grade the exams won't affect your grade too much. But he gets a 5/5 because Peter Keller has the absolute best dad jokes in the world. He tells multiple each lecture and it's so amazing. I laugh everytime at his amazing dad jokes!

He is ok but his slide have many small error that sometime I need to wonder whether he types wrong again or it is me who don't understand. Weekly assignment relates to slide and take time to work. Midterm is MC and ok, average is 68. Final is MC, few shorts and 1 long Q. It is pretty decent and you can choose 1/2 or 2/5 option for short Q.

Horrible professor. Gives you zero practice problems, only lecture slides absolutely riddled with spelling errors that you can't understand them, and you are expected to know how to solve complex equations on the exam. Dr. Keller needs to learn how to organize a course! There are no tools for you to study, you have to google stuff to learn...

I don't know if I've ever met someone as good with dad jokes as Dr. Keller!!! His jokes in class are always the best and make classes enjoyable. He also finishes covering material and is decent at explaining. However his lecture slides and lab assignments are filled with gruesome spelling mistakes, making it hard to understand what he is asking.

Great professor, but I wish there were more components to the course, like practice exams/questions or homework so that you can boost your marks. There is only the lab component (40%), midterm and final exam. There were mistakes in the lectures which often made the labs more difficult. Aside from that I really enjoyed this course and his dad jokes.
Most hilarious professor at SFU. The way he talks gives everyone chuckles and he is really good at dad jokes.
